driver.name: IEC 62056-21
driver.description: This driver can read meters using IEC 62056-21 Mode A, B and C.

option.name: Serial port
option.description:
The physical device address to uniquely identify a physical smart meter.

Example:
  1. Linux: /dev/ttyS0 or /dev/ttyUSB0
  2. Windows: COM1

option.name: Baud rate change delay
option.description:
The baud rate change delay sets the waiting time in milliseconds between a baud rate change.
Default is a delay of 0ms.

option.name: Timeout
option.description:
The timeout in milliseconds, after which the blocking call to read from the serial port will be canceled.
Default is a timeout of 2000ms.

option.name: Number of read retries
option.description:
Defines the maximum of read retries.
Default is 0.

option.name: Baud rate
option.description:
Sets an initial baud rate e.g. for devices with modem configuration.
Default is 300bd.

option.name: Fixed baud rate
option.description:
Activates a fixed baud rate.
Default is deactivated.

option.name: Device address
option.description:
The device address is mostly needed for devices with RS485.
Default is to not have a device address configured.

option.name: Request message start character
option.description:
The request message start character is used for manufacture specific request messages.
With this option you can change the default start character.

option.name: Fixed baud rate
option.description:
Reads the standard message and the manufacture specific message.
This options has only an affect if the Request message start character is changed.

option.name: Id of the data set
option.description: The id of the data set is usually an OBIS code of the format A-B:C.D.E*F or on older EDIS code of the format C.D.E. that specifies exactly what the value of this data set represents.
